hero.title: Hi, I'm Bruno Moya.

hero.description: A 23-year-old tech enthusiast from Barcelona, founder of Glassear, dedicated to making Augmented-Reality technology accessible to everyone.

about.title: More About me
paragraphs: I am Bruno Moya, a 23 year-old entrepreneur from Barcelona, being told "a 19-year-old Tech Entrepreneur that is more digital than most CTO's, CMO's & CEO's", founder and creator of Glassear. For the past years I have been working on the headset that democratizes Mixed-Reallity by effortlessly allowing users to connect and experience next-gen digital experiences.

I have won many awards and given many talks at different events explaining how I started in the world of entrepreneurship and managed to bring my #glassear product to market and compete with #Microsoft and #Google.

Not only that, but I've always been interested in working on projects that can be useful to the world, as well as learning new technologies and languages, both human and programming ones, developing projects based on Python, Java, C# or for example C++. You can have a look at them down here!

timeline.title: Curiosity Sparks the Flame
timeline.body: From a very young age, I began exploring the digital world, experimenting with computers and creating my first ideas.

timeline.title: Discovering Programming
timeline.body: At the age of 12/13, I discovered programming and fell in love with it, creating my first projects and learning to code.

timeline.title: Birth of Glassear
timeline.body: At the age of 13, I launched Glassear, my first project to push mixed reality to new frontiers.

timeline.title: The Breakthrough Moment
timeline.body: My efforts led me to receive recognition at the Maker Faire Galicia, marking a milestone in my career.

timeline.title: Sharing My Vision
timeline.body: I began participating in conferences and talks, inspiring others about the potential of augmented and virtual reality.

items.title: Speaker - Creator
items.description: Development of software and hardware for AR using Unity 3D and ARFoundation. I have worked with Java protocols on Android, such as USB Accessory for connecting external devices and the Screen Recording API for capturing and processing content in real-time, optimizing the user experience in immersive environments.
items.moreInfo: Implementation of computer vision algorithms for interactive experiences. Use of vision models like Yolo and OpenCV, for example in my TFG GlassFood. Development of web interfaces with HTML, CSS, and React (Next.js). Example: www.glassear.com/music. Integration of APIs and performance optimization for a better user experience. Presentations at national events on AR and emerging technology. Industry 4.0 Award at Maker Faire Galicia 2018. Jury member at Maker Faire Galicia 2019. Talks at Google Developer Groups (GDG) in Zaragoza and Lleida.

items.title: Technical Lead
items.description: Collaboration with the non-profit organization Fecamm (Federació Catalana de malalties minoritàries), in the process of introducing games to their platform so that people with rare diseases can play. In relation to this, we have organized a month-long GameJam in collaboration with UAB, UPC, and various hospitals

items.title: Freelance Developer
items.description: Development of the Hess Test: Creation of an application for psychological evaluation in human resources, with React on the frontend and PHP on the backend. The tool, scientifically validated by its creator, Gaspar, is used by companies in the sector for talent selection and analysis.
items.moreInfo: Implementation of databases, automated email sending, and user management in a WordPress-based environment. Use of processing queues for high performance in systems with limited resources, optimizing execution on shared hosting. Ensuring cross-platform compatibility and optimization for different devices and browsers. Development of the backend as a WordPress plugin, facilitating integration with other systems.

items.title: Computer Vision internship
items.description: Development of AI applied to pose tracking, face tracking, and object tracking in an Android app created with Java.
items.moreInfo: My tutor was Edgar Riba, creator of Kornia, a library with over 10.4k stars on Github. Quote, 'Sometimes we forgot how young he was when assigning him tasks'.

items.title: Hand Tracking AR/VR Internship
items.description: Development of AR applications for Glassear, using the ManoMotion SDK. Design of AR interfaces and optimization of hand tracking algorithms.
items.moreInfo: Work with OpenCV and neural networks to improve gesture detection. Certificate available at: https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:6559408874229760001/

items.title: Glassear
items.description: The affordable mixed reality headset that competes with #Microsoft and #Google.

items.title: NotionAI MyMind
items.description: This repo uses AI and the wonderful Notion to enable you to add anything on the web to your "Mind" and forget about everything else.

items.title: Smartroom - Smartmirror
items.description: Making my room smarter with a Smart Mirror, domotics and open source voice assistant. Big updates coming soon, stay tuned!

items.title: hitornot.ml
items.description: A statistical AI model to predict whether a Spotify song will be a hit, turned into a website that learns from user input!

items.title: ManoMojies
items.description: This app allows you to place emojis on your reality, even search emojis out of the box! Fill your world with emojis right now and start building your own story!

items.title: Tripdepart
items.description: The traveling social network! Never travel alone again!

items.title: Poem Mask
items.description: An AR app that allows you to be whoever you want to be thanks to real-time searching capabilities and facemasks.

items.title: OpenCV Detectors
items.description: An Android app I programmed during my internship at CVC that has built-in detectors like face detection, body detection, or even object detection.

items.title: Warshipy.py
items.description: A game about sinking ships and bots. Made with Unity3D, Python, and Telegram.

items.title: Spotdownloader
items.description: A terminal app in Python that downloads all your music in .MP3 from a given Spotify playlist.

items.title: GlassTDR
items.description: An augmented reality app I did for my "Treball de recerca (TDR)" that allowed the teacher to experience more immersively the work I had done.

items.title: PoemAR (Formerly CatalAR)
items.description: An augmented reality app I did to learn more about Catalan Book "Tirant Lo Blanc".

items.title: Doctor Strange AR Filter
items.description: 3rd Prize at Manomotion's Gamejam themed 'Superheroes' with my Friend Avraam Georgiadis.

items.title: Wanderpi
items.description: Keep your best travel memories organized, and your costs to the letter.

items.title: Patient73 First and Second Edition Gamejam
items.description: Due to my collaboration with Fecamm and Patient73, I had the honor of being one of the organizers of the first and secon edition of the Patient74 Gamejam in collaboration with RCDE.

items.title: GuideLife - PayRetailersUAB
items.description: AI-powered platform providing intelligent assistance in health, finance, climate, and energy.

items.title: Hack_FGC
items.description: Accessible ticketing solution for public transport, integrating LLM for real-time assistance.

items.title: SeiVoice
items.description: Voice-controlled assistant for supermarket purchasing and management, developed for Seidor company during HackUPC 2024 hackathon in a single weekend.

awards.title: Awards, Certificates & Publications
awards.subtitle: Milestones & Recognition
awards.description: Throughout my journey in tech and entrepreneurship, I've been honored to receive recognition for innovation, creativity, and technical achievement.

items.title: Maker Faire Galicia Award Industry 4.0
items.description: Awarded for the innovation and creativity demonstrated with the Glassear mixed reality headset project for the future of Industry 4.0.

items.title: 3rd Prize - Superheroes AR GameJam
items.description: Awarded third place in Manomotion's GameJam for the Doctor Strange AR Filter created with Avraam Georgiadis.

items.title: 3rd Prize -  Manomojies Gamejam
items.description: Winner of the 3rd prize in the Gamejam organized by Manomotion, based on the theme of using Hand Tracking and augmented reality mixed with emojis.

items.title: Hand Tracking Certification
items.description: Certified in hand tracking technology for AR/VR applications after completing an internship with Manomotion.

items.title: Featured in Spain's Leading Economic Journal
items.description: Recognized by El Economista, Spain's leading economic journal, for pioneering work in affordable mixed reality technology.

items.title: TDR Excellence Award
items.description: Received top mark (10/10) for 'Le casque de réalité augmentée abordable' research project in Double French-Spanish baccalaureate program.

items.title: India's First Immersive Digital Technologies Summit Speaker
items.description: Selected as a featured speaker at India's first immersive digital technologies summit, recognized as 'a 19-year-old Tech Entrepreneur more digital than most CTO's, CMO's & CEO's'.

items.title: Computer Vision Certification
items.description: Earned certification in computer vision technologies after successful completion of internship at the Computer Vision Center.

items.title: Hackathon Winner Most Creative Project
items.description: My role as a computer engineering student has opened my mind to developing more scientific projects, having won the award for the most creative project with my app 'Whatshate,' sponsored by Everis, which directly and simply fights against cyberbullying.

items.title: Maker of Merit
items.description: One of only 4 special awards granted by the organization to the most interesting Maker of the event. Received a special recognition signed by David Cuartelles, co-founder of Arduino.

items.title: GlassFood - TFG (Final Degree Project) with AR Poster Experience
items.description: Received exceptional grade (9.8/10) for my Final Degree Project which combines mixed reality technology, computer vision and deep learning to create a health-focused application for the Glassear headset that detects ingredients and suggests healthy recipes with nutritional information through an immersive 3D interface. The project featured an AR experience poster displayed in the university hallway.

items.title: Create an Augmented Reality app in one hour with Bruno Moya
items.description: One-hour online course where I teach the basics of developing an Augmented Reality application using Unity 3D and ARFoundation.

items.title: Glassear, mixed reality within everyone's reach
items.description: Article written for the virtual magazine on 3D printing in a special edition dedicated to mixed and virtual reality!

awards.contactText: Would you like to learn more about my achievements or invite me to participate in an event?

items.description: I form part of the University's entrepreneurship club and I have given a speech there.

items.institution: École de technologie supérieure (ÉTS) - Montreal, Quebec, Canada
items.description: I finished my last year at ÉTS University in Montreal, Canada (5 months) ÉTS is one of the largest universities in Quebec.
TDR: 'Le casque de réalité augmentée abordable' Mark : 10. Due to this I have the Spanish BACHELOR and French BACHELOR, that means a B2 level of French.
